item.title: Anne add a quote by Rush Limbaugh
item.description: "Liberals measure compassion by how many people are given welfare. Conservatives measure compassion by how many people no longer need it." -- Rush Limbaugh

item.title: Anne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Anne add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "If we ever forget that we're one nation under God, then we will be one nation gone under." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Anne add a quote by Jonah Goldberg
item.description: "America's political system used to be about the pursuit of happiness. Now More and more of us want to stop chasing it and have it delivered." -- Jonah Goldberg

item.title: Anne add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I would rather be exposed to the inconveniences attending too much liberty than to those attending too small a degree of it." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Anne add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "If we could follow the slogan that says,"Turn off the TV and open a good book" we would do something of substance for a future generation." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Anne add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Anne add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing but newspapers." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Anne add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Anne add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Once a month, some women act like men act all the time." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Anne add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Anne add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There's no use going to school unless your final destination is the library." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Anne add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "A pioneer is not someone who makes her own soap. She is one who takes up her burdens and walks toward the future." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Anne add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Anne add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Anne add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Rummaging in our souls, we often dig up something that ought to have lain there unnoticed. " -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Anne add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I always loved you, and if one loves anyone, one loves the whole person, just as they are and not as one would like them to be. -Dolly" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Anne add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "it's much better to do good in a way that no one knows anything about it." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Anne add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger
